com.ae.apps.lib.db

Class CopiedDataBaseHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper
      • com.ae.apps.lib.db.CopiedDataBaseHelper
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public abstract class CopiedDataBaseHelper
extends android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper
    Boiler plate code for a Database file that is copied from the assets folder

    • Method Detail

      • createDataBase

        public void createDataBase()
        Creates the database

      • checkDataBase

        protected boolean checkDataBase()
        Check if the database already exist to avoid re-copying the file each time you open the application.
        Returns:
        true if it exists, false if it doesn't

      • copyDataBase

        protected void copyDataBase()
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Copies your database from your local assets-folder to the just created empty database in the system folder, from where it can be accessed and handled. This is done by transferring byte stream.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • openDataBase

        public void openDataBase()
                  throws android.database.SQLException
        Opens the database
        Throws:
        android.database.SQLException - while opening the database
